edu.grinnell.bresette.doughert1.JSON

Class Parse

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.grinnell.bresette.doughert1.JSON.Parse

  • public class Parse
extends java.lang.Object
    a class that hold parsing methods for JSON
    Author:
    Leonora Bresette Buccino and Helen Dougherty

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Parse()

      static java.lang.Object parse(JSONInput json)
      A method that parses a JSONInput object and returns an object representing that JSONInput
      static java.lang.Object parse(java.lang.String str)
      A method that parses a string of JSON input and returns an object representing that JSON string

      a method that parses an ArrayList

      a method that parses an object
      static java.lang.Object parseString(JSONInput json)
      a method that parses a String
      static java.lang.String unparse(java.lang.Object ob)
      A method to parse a Java object to a string of JSON The Java object may be a String, a Hashtable, an ArrayList, a BigDecimal number, the booleans true or false, or null.

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public static java.lang.Object parse(java.lang.String str)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        A method that parses a string of JSON input and returns an object representing that JSON string
        Parameters:
        str - a String of JSON input
        Returns:
        an Object representing the JSON input
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        Preconditions:
        str must be valid JSON
        Postconditions:
        returns a object representing JSON input from str

      • parseArray

        public static java.lang.Object parseArray(JSONInput json)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        a method that parses an ArrayList
        Parameters:
        json - A JSONInput object, with a string value and an index
        Returns:
        an object representing the JSON inupt
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there is not a closing brace
        Preconditions:
        the input must have an open brace and close brace
        Postconditions:
        the index of the JSONInput variable moves to after the close brace in the value string

      • parseString

        public static java.lang.Object parseString(JSONInput json)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        a method that parses a String
        Parameters:
        json - a JSONInput object with a string value and an int index
        Returns:
        returns the JSON object represented by the string value
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there is no closing quotation mark or if there is invalid use of a backslash
        Preconditions:
        the input must have an open and close quote
        Postconditions:
        the index of the JSONInput variable moves to after the end quote in the value string

      • parseObject

        public static java.lang.Object parseObject(JSONInput json)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        a method that parses an object
        Parameters:
        json - a JSONInput object with a string value and an int index
        Returns:
        returns the JSON object represented by the JSONInput string
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the object is not formatted properly, if it does not have a string key, or it does not have a value or close bracket
        Preconditions:
        the input must have an open and close bracket, the key must be a string and the key and value must be separated by a colon
        Postconditions:
        the index of the JSONInput variable moves to after the end bracket in the value string

      • parseNumber

        public static java.lang.Object parseNumber(JSONInput json)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        a method that parses a number
        Parameters:
        json - a JSONInput object with a string value and an int index
        Returns:
        returns the number represented by the string value
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the number in the string is formatted incorrectly
        Preconditions:
        the input must be a properly formatted number, it can start with a -, . or a number, and it can include one decimal point and the letter e
        Postconditions:
        the index of the JSONInput variable moves to after number

      • parseLiteral

        public static java.lang.Object parseLiteral(JSONInput json)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        a method that parses a literal
        Parameters:
        json - a JSONInput object with a string value and an int index
        Returns:
        returns the literal represented by the input string
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the input is not null, true or false and is therefore an invalid literal
        Preconditions:
        the input must be a valid literal (null, true, or false)
        Postconditions:
        the index of the JSONInput variable moves to after the literal

      • parse

        public static java.lang.Object parse(JSONInput json)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        A method that parses a JSONInput object and returns an object representing that JSONInput
        Parameters:
        json - a JSONInput object with a string value and int index
        Returns:
        an Object representing the JSON input
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        Preconditions:
        JSONInput.value must be valid JSON
        Postconditions:
        the index moves after each type of object is parsed

      • unparse

        public static java.lang.String unparse(java.lang.Object ob)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        A method to parse a Java object to a string of JSON The Java object may be a String, a Hashtable, an ArrayList, a BigDecimal number, the booleans true or false, or null.
        Parameters:
        ob - a java Object
        Returns:
        a string of JSON representing the object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        Preconditions:
        the object must be either a String, ArrayList, Hashtable, BigDecimal, or one of the allowed literal valuse
        Postconditions:
        returns a string of JSON
